column4: I just downloaded Limewire for linux.  It was an RPM file.  How do I install it under ubuntu?
follow this guide: Shu [n=shoo@58.179.114.21]  has quit ["Leaving"]
the same as if you use -p (preserve) -r (recurse) -d (dereference)
providing you have read permission on those files
if you dont want them to be owned by root you can change that
use chgrp as well, otherwise some of the files will be in root's group
same command but chgrp instead of chown
yes, if your changing permissions of a root owned file (which is what you said you were doing)
no, that is a common way to update
